shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dawit “Psalter” (fols. 2r-172ra) I-1) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David” (fols. 2r–132v) I-2) Mäḫalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 132v–147r) I-3) Mäḫalǝyä mäḫalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 147v–155r) I-4) Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” (fols. 156ra–167ra) I-5) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “The Gate of Light” (fols. 167rb–172ra)
Additiones 1-8.

donors.donor: The name of the original donor/owner has been erased from the supplication on fol. 156ra. Supplication formulas containing the names of Ṣǝlatä Muse (fol. 37r) and Gäbrä Giyorgis (fols. 45r, 132v) have been added beside the title of the Pss., in a secondary crude hand. The supplication and/or the names have been erased from fols. 51v, 73r, 82r.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is worn and shows traces of intensive use. Both boards are broken and repaired with cords. The leather cover is missing; its traces are visible on the inner sides of the boards. The sewing has been crudely repaired with synthetic threads and stitches. Holes are amended on fols.: 36, 56, 86, 95, 133, 153, 159, 162.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (both broken and repaired). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible in the centre fold of the quires, one close to the head and one close to the tail of the codex.

txfolios.txfolio: Fol. 139 mistakenly numbered as 140. Henceforth the erroneous folio numbering continues up to the end of the Ms.

squires.squire:
A(1; s.l.: 1, stub after 1/fol. 1r-v) – I(10/fols. 1r-11v) – II(10/fols. 12r-21v) – III(10/fols. 22r-31v) – IV(10/fols. 32r-41v) – V(10/fols. 42r-51v) – VI(10/fols. 52r-61v) – VII(10/fols. 62r-71v) – VIII(10; s.l.: 4, stub after 7; 7, stub after 4/fols. 72r-81v) – IX(10/fols. 82r-91v) – X(10/fols. 92r-101v) – XI(10/fols. 102r-111v) – XII(10/fols. 112r-121v) – XIII(6/fols. 122r-131v) – XIV(2/fols. 130r-131v) – XV(10/fols. 132r-141v) – XVI(10/fols. 143r-152v) – XVII(10/fols. 153r-162v) – XVIII(10/fols. 163r-172v).
The structure of quires XIII and XIV is uncertain.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data for fol. 4r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-4, I-5: all data for fol. 163r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Careful, regular, by a well-trained hand

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra (name of Mary in Texts I-4 and I-5); title and number of the Pss., Canticles and Songs; title of Texts I-2, I-3, I-5; title and incipit of the daily readings of Text I-4; refrains of Texts I-4 and I-5 (written out fully or abbreviated); name and traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
Two groups of lines on the incipit page of Text I-1.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ብ፡ for ብሂል፡ in some of the interpretations of the Hebrew letters in Psalm 118. ስ፡ for ስቡሕኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወልዑልኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ለዓለም (Canticle 10, fols. 143r-v) Text I-4: ሰ፡ ለ፡ ቅ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain: ሠ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fol. 156ra-vb) እ᎓/እስ᎓ for በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 157rb-158vb) ኵ፡/ኵሉ፡ for ኵሉ፡ ትውልድ፡ ያስተበፅዑኪ፡ ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ (fols. 159ra-160va) ናዓ᎓ for ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። እስመ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ይኵን፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵልነ (fols. 161va-162ra) ተፈ᎓/ተፈሥ᎓ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ (fol. 165ra-vb) ወበ᎓/ወበእ᎓ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 166rb-167ra) Text I-5 ወ፡ ሣ፡ ይ(ክ)፡ for ወልድኪ፡ ሣህሎ፡ ይክፍለነ፡ ሰ፡ ለ፡ ቅ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain: ወበ᎓/ወበእ᎓ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 168rb-171va)

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Text I-1 begins with an inscription: ዳዊት፡ ገብረ፡ በመዋሊሁ፡ ፪፻፹ወ፰፡ መዘምራን. - Numerous mistakes in the numbering of the Pss.

additional.det: The text is poorly legible; most probably written in the same poor hand as Additiones 2-5, 7, 8.

additional.cont: Fol. 1v: Hymn honouring Jesus Christ (nǝguś Fema).
additional.det: The text is poorly legible; most probably written in the same poor hand as Additiones 1, 3-5, 7, 8.

additional.cont: Fol. 131r: Protective prayer against wild animals.
additional.det: The note is written in a mixture of Gǝʿǝz and Amharic; most probably written in the same poor hand as Additiones 1, 2, 4, 5, 7, 8. The writer makes various carnivorous animals swear that they will not damage the property of individuals.

additional.cont: Fol. 155r: Calendaric notes of unclear content.
additional.det: The note is most probably written in the same poor hand as Additiones 1-3, 5, 7, 8. The end part of the notes resembles a magical text (chain of apparently meaningless rhyming words). The last words are in Amharic.
The note is most probably written in the same poor hand as Additiones 1-4, 7, 8.

additional.cont: Fol. 172rb: Divination text.
additional.det: The note is written in Amharic, in a hand not much posterior to the main hand.
The note is The note is most probably written in the same poor hand as Additiones 1-5, 8. Owner's name deleted; pledge is added, to denounce the Satan before the church of Maryam Ṣǝyon (in Aksum?).

additional.cont: Fol. 172va-vb: Protective prayer agains Barya and Legewon (Ṣälot bä-ˀǝntä barya wä-legewon).
additional.det: The note is most probably written in the same poor hand as Additiones 1-5, 7.

extras.extra: - Texts I-1 (fols. 17v-26r, 45r-52r), I-4 and I-5 contain musical notation written in a secondary hand. - The midpoint of the “Psalms of David” (in Ps. 77) is marked on fol. 67v. - Single Ethiopic letters are written in the margin of many fols., e.g., fol. 7r l.1, probably to mark the verse from which the scribe was to begin copying. - An Ethiopic numeral ፲ is written in the margin of many fols., e.g., fol. 15r l.3, for an unknown purpose. - In Ps. 135 (here 140) on fol. 121r-v, a directive በል ‘say’ is written beside the refrain እስመ፡ ለዓለም፡ ምሕረቱ ‘for his mercy endures forever’ to be repeated after each verse. - In Canticle 10 on fol. 143r-v, a directive በል ‘say’ is written beside the refrain ስቡሕኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወልዑልኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ለዓለም ‘praise and exalt Him above all forever’ to be repeated after each verse. - Directives to the ministers written in the main hand in the upper margin of fols.: 3v, 6r, 9v. - Inscriptions referring to the respective Pss. and divination practices written in a secondary hand in the upper margin of e.g., fols. 3r, 4r, 6v-7r, 8v, 9r, 10r, 11r, 12v, 15v, 16r, 19r. - The scribe reduced the size of his handwriting to accommodate the end of the line: fols. 8v, 36r, 36v, 50r, 61v, 71r, 83v, 88r, 105v, 107r, 113r, 116r, 116v, 117r, 141v, 142r, 145v. - Part of the line is taken up: fols. 105v, 118r. - Part of the line is taken down: fols. 26r, 43r. - Tämälläs-signs, in the shape of two perpendicular lines, indicating the place where the omissions written in the upper margin, in the main hand, belong: fols. 160vb l.2, 161rb l.10, 164ra l.10, 166rb l.8, 168vb l.5, 171ra l.15, 171va l.15. - Omitted letters, words, lines or passages written interlineally, in the main hand: fols. 4r, 6r, 9r, 9v, 11r, 26v, 36r, 45r, 55v, 60v, 61v, 73r, 83v, 84v, 85v, 103r, 105v, 119r, 126r, 139v, 141r, 159va, 160va, 164ra. - Omitted letters, words, lines or passages written interlineally, in a secondary hand: fols. 152r, 170va, 170vb, 171ra. - Corrections written over erasures: fols. 24v, 40r, 45r, 71r, 130v, 134v, 143r, 151v. - Correction indicated by lines above and below the word: fols. 13r, 31r, 122v, 143v, 159vb, 163ra, 166rb. - Beginning of an (unfinished) ownership note. The owner’s name is erased: fol. 132v. - Beginning of an (unfinished) ownership note. Only the initial letters of the owner’s name are readable: fol. 155r (after the end of Text III). - Pen trial in the same hand as Additio 3: fol. 131r. - Scribbles: fols. 1rv, 2rv, 155rv.

frames.frame: The Pss. are divided into groups of ten separated by a line of alternating black and red dots.
